block.p: FAIRCHILD SEMICONDUCTOR CORP., South Portland, Me., whose chips are used in cellular phones, air bags and personal computers, agreed to buy the closely held Kota Microcircuits Inc., based in Loveland, Colo., and the Power Management unit of Micro Linear, based in San Jose, Calif., for $21 million in stock and cash.

FAIRCHILD SEMICONDUCTOR CORP., South Portland, Me., whose chips are used in cellular phones, air bags and personal computers, agreed to buy the closely held Kota Microcircuits Inc., based in Loveland, Colo., and the Power Management unit of Micro Linear, based in San Jose, Calif., for $21 million in stock and cash.

ROYAL DUTCH/SHELL GROUP, London, the world's second-largest oil and gas company, said it would sell its Kraton polymers unit to divest itself of a noncore asset. The price was not disclosed. The buyer is Ripplewood Holdings L.L.C., a private equity investment firm based in New York.

NORTHPOINT COMMUNICATIONS GROUP, San Francisco, a provider of digital subscriber line service, said it had received a $150 million cash investment from Verizon Communications, the country's largest wireless service provider.
NORTH CAROLINA NATURAL GAS, Raleigh, N.C., a unit of CP&L Energy Inc., agreed to sell its propane division to the closely held Jenkins Gas and Oil Co. for an undisclosed price.
